file_content.text: Your mission to Coruscant must not fail. I have faith in you.
Master Orgus has been telling us of your heroism. We're all in your debt.
You should obey Master Orgus's instructions. May the Force be with you.
And take this. The code is a source of strength, but some backup never hurts. I'll see you soon in the Council chambers.
Welcome, Padawan. The temple is already buzzing with accounts of your heroism in the training grounds.
Master Orgus told me you battled Flesh Raiders--and a Force user armed with a lightsaber.
That must have been a disturbing confrontation. Are you alright?
I'm sorry things ended in violence, but I'm glad to be alive.
Shaken but solid.
I'll be fine.
I admire your composure, but have you truly searched your feelings about this?
I won the fight. What else matters?
Better than ever.
Even the most experienced Jedi can be unbalanced by violence.
Taking a life affects the Living Force--and the one who does the killing.
This is why Jedi enter battles calmly, with reason. Emotions like fear and anger lead to the dark side.
I can control my feelings, no matter what I'm facing.
I'm strong enough to resist.
The man I fought wasn't angry or fearful.
My enemy seemed calm.
Not on the surface, perhaps.
You can't expect me to be reasonable in the heat of battle.
Sounds impossible.
That's the paradox all Jedi face when they fight. You will find a way. You must.
As the Jedi Code teaches us, "There is no emotion, there is peace." Remember those words when times are darkest.
Padawan--I'm Satele Shan, leader of the Jedi Council. I'd like to speak privately with you before we meet with the others.
You have my full attention, Master. What do you need?
Go ahead, I'm listening.
This isn't a discussion for a comm channel.
Have I done something wrong?
Am I in trouble?
No, and don't worry, this will be an informal meeting.
Let me guess--my reputation precedes me.
I'm famous already, eh?
Your reputation is not my concern.
Come to my meditation room in the temple. We'll talk there.
